text:
Say I have a file containing some text and some variables that I would like to fill in. How can I get String interpolation to work here?

e.g. file “exp.txt” contains “blah blah = $(var)”

`julia> var = "good explanation"`
`"good explanation"`
`julia> s = read("exp.txt", String)`
`"blah blah = \$(var)"`
`julia> s`
`"blah blah = \$(var)"`

I want s = “blah blah = good explanation”
I think I am missing something simple. Help?

```julia> replace(s, "\$(var)"=>var)
"blah blah = good explanation"```
the problem is how automatic you need this to be and why are you doing this? (i.e. is there something you could have done differently in previous step?

Thanks. A bunch of `replace` s could work. I was hoping for the same magic simplicity you get when interpolating from the REPL.

`julia> var1,var2,var3 = "super","duper","great"`
`("super", "duper", "great")`
`julia> s =  """blah blah = $(var1), better = $(var2), best = $var3 """`
`"blah blah = super, better = duper, best = great "`

Yes, I will look at Mustach.jl. Thanks!
